data.title: Nalbandian survives scare
data.meta_description: Third seed David Nalbandian survived a determined challenge from Russia's Dmitry Tursuov to eventually move into the third round on Day Six.
data.text:
ByEurosport

Published 02/06/2006 at 20:26 GMT

Third seed David Nalbandian survived a determined challenge from Russia's Dmitry Tursuov to eventually move into the third round on Day Six.

TENNIS 2006 French Open 3R Nalbandian

Image credit: Reuters

Match of the day:

In the undoubted match of the day the third seed, and one of the favourites for the title at Roland Garros, had to come back from two sets down to book a place in the fourth round on Friday.

Dmitry Tursunov launched onto the offensive in the early stages of his match on Court Two but eventually started to tire as David Nalbandian wore him down with his accuracy and fitness.

French Open

Few surprises in Paris

12/06/2006 at 09:33

As a result, the 2004 semi-finalist moved one step closer to his anticipated semi-final showdown against top seed Roger Federer.

Re-Live: Nalbandian v Tursunov

7-Tommy Robredo (ESP) beat Lukas Dlouhy (CZE) 6-1 6-4 6-2

Martin Vassallo Arguello (ARG) beat Raemon Sluiter (NED) 2-6 6-4 6-3 3-6 6-1

6-Nikolay Davydenko (RUS) beat 30-Carlos Moya (ESP) 6-1 7-5 6-3

12-Mario Ancic (CRO) beat Albert Montanes (ESP) 6-1 6-2 6-4

10-Gaston Gaudio (ARG) beat 24-Juan Carlos Ferrero (ESP) 7-5 7-5 7-6(7)

8-James Blake (USA) beat Nicolas Almagro (ESP) 6-7(5) 6-2 6-4 6-4

2-Rafael Nadal (ESP) beat Kevin Kim (USA) 6-2 6-1 6-4

15-David Ferrer (ESP) beat Jeremy Chardy (FRA) 6-1 6-4 3-6 6-1

Juan Monaco (ARG) beat 28-Fernando Verdasco (ESP) 4-6 6-4 6- 6-1
